results.title: Talent nite
results.brief_description: A cut-out animation of various humanised objects that perform on stage at a cabaret style nightclub. Dancing to a jazz-blues soundtrack the objects, and male crooner take it in turn to perform. The audience is eventually won over by an alluring stilleto shoe that symbolises woman and the womanly aspects of cabaret. Co-directed/animated/designed and concept by Craig L. Brooks and Nicole McKinnon.

results.title: Talent auction
results.creator_credit: Milton Schwarzwald, Frank Jessop and Nu-Atlas Productions
results.brief_description: An auctioneer auctions off a variety of entertainers including singers, dancers and musicians. Features Irene Beasely, The Mercy Macs, The Five Reillys, Paul Robinson, Bobby Bernard. Orchestra conducted by Josef Gershenson.

results.title: Taleb and his lamb: a Bedouin tale about right and wrong - discipline and responsibility.
results.creator_credit: Ami Amitai, Barr Films and Amitai Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film is subtitled, “A Bedouin tale about right and wrong - discipline and responsibility. “The tale is about Taleb, a shepherd’s son, who has a pet lamb from his father’s flock. Taleb steals the lamb, after it is taken to the market to be sold for slaughter, and hides in the desert with it. The angry father finds them, but how the story ends is left up to the viewer to decide.
results.title_for_label: Taleb and his lamb: a Bedouin tale about right and wrong - discipline and responsibility.

results.title: Tale of two cities
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Charles Dickens’ immortal tale of romance and intrigue set against the lurid background of the French Revolution. Dirk Bogarde stars as Sydney Carlton whose final act of self-sacrifice brings the story to its dramatic end. Also stars Dorothy Tutin and Cecil Parker, Leo McKern, Christopher Lee and Donald Pleasence.

results.title: Tale of Three Cities
results.creator_credit: Pierre Desbonnet, Gilbert Lauzun and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Visits three cities from three continents in three different stages of development. Shows the problems of growth and how, if they can, plan for the future. Cities studied are: Djakarta (Indonesia), Caracas (Venezuela) and Stockholm (Sweden).
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Tale of the three jewels = Conte des trois diamonts
results.creator_credit: Michel Khleifi, Omar Al-Qattan, BBC-TV, Arte, La Sept, Television Espanola, Sourat Films and Sindibad Films
results.brief_description: A beautiful film of young adolescent love, of dreams and fantasies, which sadly takes place in a world of conflict, hate and violence in the war-ravaged Gaza Strip. Twelve year-old Yusef (Mohammad Nahhal) lives in a refugee camp with his mother and older sister. His father is in prison and his older brother is on the run from the Israeli soldiers. To escape the surrounding violence Yusef constantly lives in an imaginary world, but it is his bird hunting in the near-by countryside that allows Yusef a sense of freedom and space. It is here that Yusef meets Aida (Hana Nemah), the wild and lovely young gypsy girl from a local gypsy camp, whose beguiling eyes and smile Yusef finds hard to resist. He soon declares his love for Aida telling her he will marry her when they grow up. However Aida sets a task for Yusef before she will agree to marriage, that being he must first find three jewels missing from her grandmother’s necklace, which was brought from South America by her grandfather. And so the adventure begins as Yusef, determined, sets out on his quest to find the three missing jewels with the help of Aida and his very close friend Salah (Ghassan Abur Libda) who comes from a wealthy and influential family of orange growers. These three young Palestinian friends from such disparate backgrounds are each portrayed sensitively by the young actors involved. Combine this with superb direction from Michel Khleifi (Wedding in Galilee, Forbidden marriages in the Holy Land), stunning cinematography by Raymond Fromont, and the fact that it is the first feature film ever to be shot in the Gaza Strip, makes “Tale of the three jewels” compelling viewing. Cast also includes Makram Khouri, Bushra Qaraman, Mohammad Bakri. Winner of several international awards. In Arabic with English subtitles.
results.title_for_label: Tale of the three jewels = Conte des trois diamonts

results.title: Tale of one city
results.creator_credit: Zoran Janjic, Peter Johnson, Department of Housing, Environment and Community Development and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film uses animation in a light-hearted manner to show some of the problems of living in a modern city, the need for more careful urban planning to help alleviate these problems, and the way in which pressure groups have an important influence on the town planners.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zoran Janjic, Peter Johnson, Department of Housing, Environment and Community Development and Film Australia

results.title: Tale of a TV mouse
results.brief_description: The story of a puppet mouse named Lucille, whose entire life revolves around the television. Shows how it affects her life and what finally happens to convince her to break the TV habit. Presents the problems of habitual TV viewing and provides positive alternatives for children who watch a lot of TV.

results.title: Tal Farlow
results.brief_description: Jazz guitarist Tal Farlow provides the background music to Lye’s final film, which, although begun in the 1950s, was not recommenced until the 1980s. Unfortunately he died before completing it. It contains vertical white scratches as well as geometric white scratches on black. It was completed by Lye’s assistant Steve Jones under the supervision of Ann Lye. Supported in part by a grant from the Queen Elizabeth II Arts Council of New Zealand.

results.title: Taking their place
results.creator_credit: Loch Townsend, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Government film about the rehabilitation and re-employment of the physically handicapped in the “normal workforce”. Follows Noel Simpson, a paraplegic, through this process.
